"my attention span is close to zero, everything is horribly uninteresting. when i'm not feeling suicidal, i feel bored. life is just an endless cycle of boredom for me, i wake up and instantly feel bored and depressed. i go through every day doing absolutely nothing. sometimes i try to do something i used to enjoy like drawing or playing the guitar, but it changes nothing. <e1>it's incredibly boring and i stop after 10 minutes max</e1> because <e2>it's not worth it</e2>. not even video games hold my attention anymore. all i do is eat, listen to music and watch youtube until i can sleep again.<e3>i'm thinking of trying drugs but i don't know where to get any</e3> since <e4>i'm underage</e4>. which is probably a good thing. i don't know what to do with myself anymore, i'm considering ending it at this point."

"<e1>i was doing great in shool , but when returning after the first lockdown i began being super anxious around people and in class for no apparent reason</e1>. <e2>with that my grades dropped</e2>. i tried my hardest to correct that bs , but no luck. i also started self harming and being suicidal.now here i am a year later and the expectations of other people seem completely out of reach. can someone please explain what the fuck happened ?"

"anyone had a specific thing that helped them wake up and starting being proactive about their depression, not a cure but more of a turning point that really made you want to kick depressions ass once and for all. maybe something you heard or saw or whatever that kind of woke you up and helped you come to reality. that seems to be my problem, i cant seem to wake up and realize how miserable things are going and how much its destroying my life. its like i dont care and cant seem to overcome this threshold even though i need to. i feel blunted to real authentic emotion"

"<e1>i was feeling very down last year</e1>, <e2>as a result of the covid-19 lockdowns</e2>. i cried at least three times a day, lost all my motivation, shut myself out from the world, ignored my friends and family, and was overall very apathetic. these feelings persisted from approximately april 2020 until approximately february 2021.i am feeling much better now. i am seeing a therapist. i was diagnosed with adhd and generalized anxiety disorder, both of which i think played a big role in how things went for me last year. i have began the process of rebuilding relationships with my friends and family. my grades in school this semester were decent for the first time in more than a year.however, i was never screened for depression, and i regret that.is it possible to get retroactively screened for/diagnosed with depression? i still remember my state of mind very clearly, and i would really like to know if i could have truly been described as ""clinically depressed"". i had never felt worse in my life, and i really just want some closure now before i can truly move on."

"first off to all those posting here requesting support/advice, hats off for having the courage to reach out!i just want to say that i am suffering from depression too. <e1>i want to reach out, but dont know what to say</e1> since <e2>i dont have the right answer either</e2>. i dont want to make your post about me by sharing my stuff on it. i am afraid i might actually make it worse.<e3>i suspect there might be others on this sub who feel similarly</e3>. so <e4>if i/we dont respond, please dont take it personally</e4>."

"they made a martyr out of me!i have a bunch of people in my life that made me homeless on purpose.<e1>i'm not saying that anyone deserves homelessness</e1>,  because <e2>no one does</e2>. <e3>what i am saying is that they made me homeless</e3> for <e4>all the wrong reasons</e4>.<e5>they made me homeless</e5> because </e6>i am a nice person but also smart and capable</e6>.  so say you have this really sweet girl and she's successful in college but her sister gets jealous and conspires to make her homeless but she didn't know it was going to happen until it had already happened. she tries to convince you that you've made a terrible mistake but nobody will listen.please, i need your help.  i've been betrayed by the people i love.  i've been made homeless when i didn't deserve it. please help me! nobody will listen,  will you be the one who listens?"

"i know people have much worse problems than mine, and that this is kind of ridiculous, but it seems so hard to find a way to get over it. its a fear of inadequacy, often i overhear girls at my school talk about how they would never date a white dude. and im not riled up about one little occasion, ive heard this convo and seen it on the internet many times. enough to make me question what im even still here for. if im so unwanted, and my race is so evil, why should i stay alive? and i know people have much better reasons to be depressed, that i will never have to worry about being discriminated against, and ill likely live a stable life. and some might tell me that this is what my people have made others feel for years, and i understand that what im feeling now is no where close to what black people mustve felt from our oppression, but i just wanna live my life without feeling like everyone is displeased by my demographics presence. im probably crazy but i just want to feel happy in my own body again."

"do not do this while driving or swimming etc.  lay down on your bed- you could pass out, though unlikelyliterally hyperventilate for 50 or 100 breaths.  thats it.  fast, deep breaths that sounds like you were just running from a lion. (repeat the cycle a couple times as needed til you start feeling better) (dont strain yourself, breathe hard and fast, but be relatively comfortable doing it)it is literally a game changer, the one tip i wish i had when i felt really depressed.  ask me in the comments after trying if you want to hear my philosophy on the reason this works!i really hope this helps someone.edit: take it relative easy and build up especially if you have health problems!  it can be intense if you do it a lot at once and can virtually pass out.  im not a doctor lol, but you will know where im coming from when you feel it."

<e1>i've been prescribed sertraline and risperidone 3 weeks ago but i was too anxious to take it</e1> bc <e2>i had a deadline coming and feared the side effects may cause me to not be able to work</e2>.i'm kinda free in terms of workload now and decided to go for it

"ive been in therapy for 10 years. im so depressed every day i fantasize about killing my self. <e1>i want to die</e1> because <e2>i have to work five days a week for the rest of my life</e2> and i hate work i just dont want to do it. my job is fine and at times i like it, but i have felt this way about every job ive had in the past. how do i deal with the fact that most of my time will be spent doing something i absolutely dont want to do and being too tired to do anything i want to do on my off time."

"i can't do anything no matter what i try. literally, can't motivate myself to work, can't play video games, barely even have the energy to make this post and it's only bc i know some other people care about me. but life isn't fun. it hasn't been fun for a very long time. <e1>i don't know what the purpose of trying is</e1> because <e2>it never leads anywhere</e2>. people keep asking me how i ""know"" things won't be good but if i don't have a reason to do something in the first place why do i do it?doing things i don't want to do requires so much energy, never feels rewarding, and is just so painful. sometimes it helps other people and that makes me happy. <e3>but i'm trying to live for myself and i literally can't</e3> because <e4>i guess every other human can just robotically perform physical actions without motivation</e4>. <e5>small goals don't feel rewarding and holding myself accountable never helps</e5> because <e6>i don't know why i should care what even i think</e6>. i know that's silly but that's literally how empty i am. i can't speak or type or even stand up. i spend hours every day like this.  there's literally no reason to do anything. antidepressants don't help.would like some ideas"

"been at my job for about 2 years, have had a good handle on depression and suicidal ideation the entire time, however it has been an extremely difficult month for me. hr pulled me in today and asked what changed my attitude from being generally upbeat to ""wearing a figurative fuck off leave me alone sign on my forehead"" this month. i told them i was struggling with some home issues and now they seem overly concerned that i'm not a good fit with the company. i don't think i'll lose my job but they seem to be harping on it alot. do i just tell them straight up that i've been close to killing myself every night for the past month? or do i lie and say it's something else?"

"it's my 48th birthday.  <e1>i pretended to go to work so that i wouldnt have to pretend to be happy and celebratory today.  its too exhausting</e1>.  <e2>so i'm currently sitting in my car under a shade tree in some random parking lot</e2>.  i'm 48 today,  and i feel like i've peaked."

talking to a friend of 15+ years online tonight. he told me that he did a will and testament if he dies (he has addiction problems). i asked how would i know if he died (we are now in different countries). i told him that i gave direction to my family to tell a handful of 'friends' if i would die.he said i wouldn't know and he is not concerned with that.ouch.

"i am having suicidal thoughts, and i try all sorts of things to make those thoughts go away. i haven't had professional help yet (not much money in my pocket right now). this led me to wonder whether depression is curable (in plain words: does it really end?).do the sad thoughts just go away?if not then, how do you deal with it differently (now)?if yes, then what steps did you take to reach this point?"
any tips for dealing with weight gain due to medications? i feel such a drive to eat. i have trouble feeling full and satisfied and have food cravings.

"i don't know if this is normal or if i'm just being super dumb and just can't get over how sensitive to emotions i am but:i basically always have like really bad depression when i want to kill myself, i feel big self guilt and stuff, like i now had the feelings that was constantly faking the depression and i really didn't want to ""exist"" and i thought i was responsible for everything bad and that my friends hate me. but today, i feel happy. like the whole day. i woke up to really good day and even from the start i was happy. at the moment <e1>it felt really weird to be happy</e1> and <e2>because of that i had really small panic attack</e2>, <e3>because i didn't even want to be happy</e3>. but as the day went on and really good things happened today for me i feel like i'm doing great and i feel the happiness. <e4>like now not really</e4> because <e5>i'm talking about this shit again</e5>, but you get the point at least. i hope... anyways, i still miss the sad comforting feeling and i don't really feel comfortable that much now. but it feels pretty weird to me to be honest. i hope that it's normal and i wasn't just pretending to have depression..."

"i will try to give as much detail as possible to what happened to me. unfortunately, it so happened that due to the problems in my life, i suffer from depression. a month ago, i could still play computer games and feel pleasure from them, even considering that i was depressed, but then at one point everything changed. i have experienced the worst episode of depression in my life that i have ever had. in one fucking moment, as if at the snap of my fingers, everything became disgusting to me - existence, music, tv shows, films, and most importantly, even games. i love games with all my heart, and games are a part of my life. but now i am disgusted even with them. <e1>and i'm scared</e1> because <e2>i don't know if this state will pass</e2>.what is very important is that for the first time in my life i experience such a psychological state. i've been playing games all my life and have never felt disgusted with them, but now i have a hard time getting into any game. it was as if i had lost a part of myself.<e3>and i'm scared</e3> because <e4>i can't even launch minecraft</e4>. this is more than just a game for me, and no words are enough to describe how much i love it."

"seriously, please try it.whether the sun is just coming up or on its way down. watch the sun shine on the back of the trees and the leaves glow bright green. watch the gold light reflect off of water. watch the clouds drift slowly above your head. watch the way the clouds turn to warm hues as the sun rises or falls. smell the morning dew or the incoming night rain. listen to the birds.put on a pair of headphones and listen to slow, cheerful and ambient music.and breathe.works wonders."

"i seemed to have gotten myself stuck.my energy levels seem to be low and never stays at a happy medium.when i do find myself with energy and i try doing something i normally would enjoy. but lose interest quickly.i keep trying to do housework to feel like i've achieved something on the days i have energy but that does always help.but i keep finding myself wanting to return to my bed very often and not necessary to sleep, just to lay in bed.and often my thoughts go to a dark place. like wanting to disfigure my face or my toes. or other selfharm thoughts like cutting my legs.but i've been a lucky person and seem to talk myself out of it of the major selfharm . been a few close calls though.most of the time i feel like fighting a ongoing battle within myself. paranoid thought creep in and those are hard to overcome when it feels like there's no-one to turn to.<e1>i don't many friends and  i'm quite the shy person</e1> so <e2>i try make friends online</e2>. when i do make a online friend, the friendship tents to fare quickly and the loneness digs in deeper."

im dxed with depression. i have grand aspirations to join the army. the social aspects and exercising will greatly help me more with my depression. i've read on reddit that the military as a whole doesnt play around with depression. i've been in therapy for the past few months to work towards stability and develop coping mechanisms. does anyone here have/had a similar journey?advice would be helpful.( i've figured it out.i've realized i've been scared of snapping and losing my anger  on my family members who i love. i will end up feeling remorseful about it that's my deepest fear losing my temper and my anger***.***i bottle my emotions until they just erupt

"i don't know if this is a sign of depression but i need help.recently, my friend has lacked motivation in doing things such as brushing their teeth and there doesn't seem to be a reason why. <e1>i want to help them but whenever i offer a hand for help, they decline it</e1> because <e2>they feel pathetic to ask for help</e2>. i want to help them as much as i can because i don't want our friendship to end from this (they have said they lost contact last time this happened with their other friends.) they're one of the most important people in my life but i'm really stuck right now in what i can do that would at least somewhat help them. i know that if i'm not the one who's there for them, then nobody else will. i want to find a way to make them happy but also return back to their ""normal"" self. please tell me some things i can do to support them/help them out of this. and yes, i know the change comes from them the most and that i need to be patient.they say they're fine but honestly, i don't think they are, judging by what they have told me."

"i am 18 years old. <e1>i am on ssi</e1> due to <e2>several mental illnesses and physical disabilities</e2>. as a kid, the fact i couldn't work never bothered me. but as i got older i realized i can never be a fully functioning adult.all this pressure is making my depression worse and i don't feel like trying anymore. school tells you the importance of getting a job, but i can't even do that. i am at 6th grade learning level and i am in 12th grade.i have tried working. i did art commissions, a little bit of microtasks but it's all too much. i get overwhelmed and exhausted from the smallest tasks and sleep through the entire day.how could i ever have goals or aspirations when i can't even do a simple 6th grade level worksheet? how can i do anything meaningful? i feel like i am useless to anything or anyone.just would like to say, i am not suicidal or thinking of taking my own life. i simply just don't know what to do next or how to find purpose."

"i just watched the hbo documentary about fred rogers. i cannot recommend this highly enough to people who are depressed.i cried multiple times, but good cries. im feeling quite suicidal lately and watching that gave me hope. <e1>his teachings of self love are so important and critical</e1>.so <e2>if you can, give it a watch</e2>.but like he would say, i like you, just the way you are. you are special and worthy of love."

"ive been suffering from severe depression for the last 18 months. culminated in a suicide attempt back in december. after that i managed to get myself back on my feet after a while, started therapy and was working on a course i cared about.just under a month ago, i visited where i used to live to catch up with some friends etc. i felt ready for it. it was a mistake though and it threw me back into a severe depression. actually my therapist believes i am suffering from ptsd and going back seems to bring back a lot of negativity. i wont make that mistake again hopefully.anyway, after 3 weeks of suicidal thoughts, sleeping 18 hours a day and just feeling awful... im feeling slightly better again, but still not back in a positive place. id like to get started again on my course and to begin to build back healthy habits - exercise, quit smoking etc. but i sit in front of my laptop and im really struggling to get myself to do anything at all. are there any techniques i can use to begin to build up some motion? i know once things begin to move ill start to feel better again, and long term hopefully therapy and medication can fix this bind im in... but short term im struggling to take that first step. in every direction i look, things seem very difficult."

"<e1>hi, i recently met a guy on discord and i felt like there was this connection</e1> so <e2>he was as he said but seems he also lives with depression</e2>.just so wrong timing im on my very low mood days and rapid cycle of cyclothemia days these days. i hate this when i find the person im comfortable with, i become real and it makes me to show how fucked up i am but this scares people as well.<e3>he just said i dont need drama</e3> so <e4>ofc i respected that</e4>. a lot of guys out there, i know but do we have to start looking for potential partners only when we can afford to keep things on our own when we are having melt downs? i can but sometimes i just cant when its too much and i can do that on my own if i dont have someone but i cant when i have one. if i have to wait for perfect recovery- i dont even know if that will ever happen. one way or another, i will still have those ugly days. and being exmuslim who wants to find someone like me so my family wont disown me, the chance to find the right one seems so less."

"so i recently started taking antidepressants and i'm wondering if there is a general guideline to how they reduce the symptoms of depression and such.like i'm almost two weeks into taking my anti depressants and that is what the doctor said it would probably take to start seeing results.oddly enough i woke up with a ton more energy then i usually have and i actually want to do something, but i don't know what to do lol. i tried playing video games, but still the effects of depression <e1>which blunt the feelings of enjoyment are there</e1> so <e2>i instantly get bored</e2> and don't want to play them anymore.does the  loss of interest or pleasure in most or all normal activities eventually get fixed? like is that a symptom that goes away the longer you are on the medication? because having this little bit of energy is great and i want to go to work, but i still have no interest in using the energy i have lol."

"<e1>hello, im looking for some advice on how to handle my situation. im sure some can relate</e1>. so, <e2>ive struggled with what i believe is depression for a few years</e2>. went to a therapist and then a dr who prescribed meds, etc. none of this still seems to help. i feel almost nothing and that i have to fake enthusiasm and acting like myself around friends/family. i can hardly force myself out of bed a lot of days, have a hard time responding to texts/phone calls, the whole fun deal. all this being said: i feel so overwhelmed and cluttered in my head, i end up forgetting a ton of things and letting friends and family down. even small menial things, or over planning myself trying to please people. i feel as though most people in my life dont understand my head right now and take these slip ups personally, even though ive talked with friends about how im feeling (which is so hard for me to put into words!!!). im just so drained and want time to return back to myself, meaning i think i need like two weeks of no plans with people and just handling my business and recharging. any advice on how to start and how to ensure loved ones dont take it personally?"

"i used to have a normal life. i went to work everyday, i had money to spend and i got a genuine enjoyment out of spending time with friends and family. now it is hard to imagine what that life was like. i haven't been to work in a week and my relationship with my fianc is in a bit of a bad way. i lack motivation, the motivation to go to work or even get out of bed in the morning. i used to face the day and now i do my best to hide from it.i've never felt real hopelessness before but each day that passes i feel it gets harder and harder to get a grip on myself and get it together before i fully slip away. i miss the warm feeling of the sun on my skin and the wind against my back. i shouldn't have taken those days for granted. i just want to go back and be happy again. i have good days and bad days but i feel like today is a new low. i'm not sure how i could ever crawl out of this one. is there anything i can do to break this cycle? i don't want to live like this anymore."

"when someone disrespects you regularly and you have to live with that person, it's really hard when others (i.e., therapists) try and convince you it's not about you, when you're the only person you see they disrespect in that manner. i have seen this person treat literally every single person in their lives with respect except for me. <e1>they seem to always be looking for a chance to throw in some sarcastic remark, even if it's small, and i can't even say anything against it</e1> because <e2>they then act like they have no idea what i'm talking about if i point it out</e2>.<e3>it sucks when you get treated like the loser of the family when you know you aren't</e3>, <e4>just because you listen to music in another language or watch anime or whatever their reasoning is</e4>. it's hurtful to see them be kind to everyone but you. it's hard when everyone in their lives seem to be worthy of their respect but you. and it's kind of infuriating to be told that it's not about you when it so clearly is.i don't even know what to do anymore. i thought they were changing and now i feel totally thrown back into my trauma of being bullied by this person again. i wish i could make enough to move out but i'm such an idiot that i couldn't do stem in college and now i'm poor until the forseeable future. i wanted to be

<e1>i took a gap year without telling a lot of people (only my close friends)</e1> because <e2>i was severely depressed (i even had to see a doctor and take medication)</e2> and now that im back people keep asking me why they havent seen me. i dont really want to lie but i also dont want to ruin the mood. i usually get asked this at parties. what do i tell these people?*edit: thank you so much for all the comments!!! i really made me feel more comfortable talking to people. ??

i feel so down and lonely. my husband doesnt want to talk to me. i had an episode on monday and that made him upset. hes still upset. i couldnt control myself when we argued. i just cant debate things in a calm voice. staying at home for more than a year really affected my mental health.  <e1>i lost my job last year</e1> due to <e2>the pandemic</e2> and ive been struggling to find one. nobody gave me a chance. im currently waiting for the approval of my immigrant paperwork. it may take at least 13 months to process. there are so many things going on. i started to have negative thoughts and i know thats not healthy. im trying to fight it. i just feel so desperate to have someone to talk with and will not punish me when i cant control myself. i cant share how i feel with my mom and my sister. i dont want to make them worry or judge me.

"<e1>we are a close knitted group that does not discriminate against anyone with mental health experiences and conditionslife is already hard enough</e1> <e2>this is a safe space and a lovely community</e2> for you to talk about your mental health experiences and relationship experiences without feeling unsafe, threatened or judged.>> https://t.me/huddlehumans <<join us and be part of the huddle family. we welcome you with open arms, always."

"i feel extremely lost right now. im about to graduate in a week, i left my job and home state. <e1>my mom just moved us from our home state a week before my graduation</e1> so <e2>i cant attend it sadly</e2>. i had a job where i made it my source of laughter and socialization. everyday i worked i had fun. i grew so much as a person there i went from being extremely shy with social anxiety and only playing games all day to making jokes with everyone and having a strong work ethic. though im in high school and i would work 40-50 hours a week and would be tired from my shifts i could do it all day. <e3>with this move i had to leave my job</e3> so <e4>im worried about what if i would lose all my skills i just obtained and i just lost this source of laughter too</e4>. <e5>as much as i loved working there i could have only went so far there, i also was doing multiple positions and work when hired as one</e5> so <e6>my work load was unfair</e6>. <e7>i was always complemented when working there</e7> so <e8>i always felt good about myself</e8>. i miss working there even though its only been a week. right now it feels like i have nothing. im tired of restarting life constantly. im sad that i wont have a graduation either. im just super lost and confused rn, i have no family or friends here. im just starting to go crazy."

i am almost always depressed. sometimes some people try to make me happy but i do not legitimately feel happy. if i said i was happy id be lying. then they act like im some ungrateful asshole for not being happy when they try to make me happy.are they right? am i an ungrateful asshole for not being happy?

"hello everyone. this is my first post in this sub. ? i was wondering, does anyone have any methods or anything to make morning depression go away? <e1>i sleep and wake up at the same time every day</e1> so <e2>i don't think that there's any problem in that regard</e2>. i also do exercise and eat well but the symptoms don't let up. <e3>i've seen that these can be symptoms of major depression but i don't know how could that be</e3>, since <e4>i feel pretty good the rest of the day</e4>. maybe some days are worse than others but idk.it hurts a lot. <e5>every morning i'm scared of waking up</e5> since <e6>i know that anything will make me feel depressed</e6>. oh you have online classes? <e7>how about thinking that you should drop out</e7> because <e8>you have zero motivation to do any schoolwork</e8>? you're watching a reality show? how about thinking that you are worthless and that you will never find a girlfriend since you're stuck in your house all day?it's tiring to be feeling this way every morning, and what my therapist asks me is just at what time of the day do i get depressed so that he can find the cause. but the thing is, that cause can be literally anything."

"i think depression starts from a disturbance, something bothering me mentally. an event or a series of events happening around me that i am not liking and bothering me, but i am feeling helpless enough to stop them. which causes frustration at some point. which ends up with depression. and obviously, all that affects your physical health, career, relationships, and all. it drains all motivations and enthusiasm bit by bit. i think depression is the very last stage of this mental situation where i start knowing that i am not okay and cant take it anymore.does it take courage to say yes i am depressed?does it prove me weak or a less man if i admit i am frustrated and depressed and i need an escape?is being depressed mean i have lost the reality of life?if i am trying to escape from that procrastination and being asked for the reason for those decisions and i share the reasons of me being depressed, should one be telling me that yes! you are doing the right thing and helping me to get rid of those reasons or trying to persuade me to overcome my feelings and go back to what i was going through?"

"how do you deal with depression when working 12 hour night shifts in a care home?<e1>i love my job</e1> and <e2>as im an anxious person</e2> <e3>i find working nights easier</e3> <e4>as theres less human interaction</e4>, however i cant help but struggle with the depression creeping up on me. <e5>i understand its probably</e5> because of <e6>my sleeping pattern</e6> but i want to stay motivated and positive but its just getting harder and harder. once ive finished a shift im so sore i almost crawl home and just get in to bed to sleep before getting up and doing it again - <e7>i only do a few shifts a week</e7> so <e8>its not like its every single night</e8> but im still struggling.how do people manage to work and not get overwhelmed when also dealing with depression? any tips would be hugely appreciated."

havent really left my house in 4 days. called out at work yesterday for no reason and today is my day off. cant find the energy to do things. i feel too insecure to even try. i want to do things and be out but i always make up some excuse to not do it. <e1>probably sound so lame but its embarrassing to talk about with my actual friends</e1> bc <e2>they dont really understand</e2>..

"i dont mean to appear ungrateful but i fear that this is the only outlet i have to turn to when i'm depressed or anxious. i feel alone, but i'm not; yet i want to be. i'm staying with a family member and i wish she wasn't here so i could cry or ball up or anything. i need time alone to finally cry. i havent cried in a long time. even supposedly helpful places like the crisis line or 7cups cant even help me. friends and family time and time again have disappointed me with their inattentiveness, and i have disappointed them with my inactivity and failure.ive gotten off my meds on purpose; which could definitely be a contributor. they just made me so anxious i didnt know what to do.i feel depressed and like no one really cares about me. i'm just a burden on my current guardians, and my friends dont particularly seem concerned; just...kind of like i'm a mild distraction, or a nuisance.<e1>i left a friend group chat</e1> due to <e2>feeling like i was just being annoying</e2>. a friend of mine brought it up and i dont know what to say to them; i appreciate the concern but i feel as if its mandatory for them to do it...reddit has been very helpful, especially knowing there are a bunch of other people who feel the same"

"you can spend ages telling the same people over and over again that you're depressed and that you need help, but they might not listen and they might not care. you just need to end up telling the right person; telling someone new, whether it is a doctor, or a therapist a friend or a family member; telling someone new, opens the possibilities of help. my biggest regret is that i didn't tell the right person sooner."

"how do you cope with knowing that depression is a mental illness/state that never really gets cured or goes away? how do you cope with knowing that youll never be at peace or happy? im struggling a lot with this. im trying to work on it in therapy, but it feels very much like the dark cloud will never recede and ill always be going through life with a sense of dread covering everything i do. how can i ever be satisfied with simply managing or coping instead of really progressing and finding a good stable place to be? im constantly dreading whats coming or feeling guilty at the things ive failed to do in the past and it feels never ending and hopeless."

"my(21f) partner(23m) has been depressed for a few years now but we got together only about 6 months ago. we've known each other for 12 years and now we're both in the same university. he has panic attacks and a very unbalanced cycle. i'm spending most of my time with him, cooking for him, holding him through his attacks and trying to take care of him in general.problem is that i'm struggling with my emotions. <e1>i have a lot more work on my plate than he does which irks him</e1> as <e2>he's been the academic topper all these years</e2>. so <e3>he doesn't want me to stay in his room</e3> while i send emails or do any work in general. so <e4>i push the work for later</e4> and stay with him but now all the deadlines are on me and i'm stressed. i don't want to get to the point where i get resentful of him. <e5>he got annoyed at me today</e5> for <e6>leaving early in the morning</e6> because <e7>i had a deadline in a couple of hours</e7>.i love him and he loves me. but my inability to empathize with him and be there for him is straining our relationship. how can i help him more than i am without it affecting our relationship? please help."

"i live with my friends and we were looking for flats together but <e1>they suddenly told me theyre gonna live on their own</e1>. living with friends is hard but hearing them say they need to prepare for next year of uni and different situations and stuff has made me feel like a complete burden, which is something i feel enough on a daily basis. <e2>they pointed out my mental health jokes scares them</e2> (like lol imma kms because of this exam) and i get that and im sorry. ive apologised. and i havent really spoken to them since. its awkward being in the same house now, knowing they dont want to live with me. ive been steadily on meds and therapy and have been improving even my therapist said so. this is really making me feel like utter sh*t. i am horrible and no one likes me. i think living alone will be better for me so i can focus on myself. even though in the past they said no we have to live together i dont feel like i can talk to them normally, or joke around. nevertheless about how i feel or mental health. i feel horrible and like ending my life."

you may be asking why? well...basically i vented about how i  hate the world we live in or something like that. then for some dumbass reason <e1>they to ban me</e1> for some reason.  <e2>maybe for "encouraging suicidal thoughts"</e2> even then what am i supposed to do? not state my reasons? and they ban me but not people faking having suicidal thoughts. honestly i don't get people sometimes...

"theres so many things that contribute to it but one of them is getting a so. i try not to care and i am like i dont even want a girlfriend to my friends but inside i really do want one. <e1>i blew my chance with my crush</e1> so <e2>that fucking sucks</e2>, i just dont have the confidence to go up to one and just talk to them, i would say im a semi confident person but only to people i dont find as a person i would be with if that makes any sense, i just need help and <e3>i am getting so depressed</e3> because <e4>every time im depressed about it</e4>, i open instagram and i see some girl with her boyfriend all happy and it gets me pissed, i just wish i had more confidence and was better looking i guess. every day seems worse and worse about everything in the world, my grades are shit and all my relatives keep dying or going to prison, shit sucks. i just wish i could have someone to listen to me, all my friends i ask are you ok or how you doing, but nope no one cares about me as usual. fml."

"hi,i work at a gas station and everyday i have to deal with a lot of nonsense. from both coworkers and customers. coworkers can be ok at times but there are times when they do not want to have responsibility or try to blame me for something.customers are the worst. people come and throw money, give me $50 in singles one after another or <e1>people get mad over</e1> <e2>asking for id</e2>. i had a guy who tried to record me since he started arguing with me <e3>since he only had a printed id</e3> and <e4>can't accept that</e4>. or if i do something like stocking or organizing, people violently knock the counter. it is too frustrating.i need the money and have no family for support. i am not sure what other kind of job to get but i need the money. i return home and keep thinking of that negativity."

"was diagnosed with depression in october, but been without friends for a long time. years. i've been trying to make progress. i was recently diagnosed with aspergers which made me feel worse. my ex, who i've been close to, is now talking to a new guy (we split up in august last year but still kept close and there was always the possibility of us getting back together). meanwhile, the third date i was meant to go on has been cancelled, and i have nothing. noithing to do. <e1>all i do is sit at home, i cry myself to sleep</e1>, because <e2>i cannot bare the loneliness</e2>. i hate this life. i just want a different one. i'm told i should be grateful for having a stable family and good education etc, and whilst i am glad in that regard, as to education, being intelligent has never made me happy. i've grown up far too quickly, i'm 18 and supposed to start university in autumn. if i have to wait til then to make friends or do anything, i mean i cant even seem to get a job....i'm done with life."

"i am a junior in college trying to study for my last final (physics 2) of this semester. i am a biochem major, and usually i do very well in my classes despite struggling with depression. with this class, though, i just dont seem to get it. i havent gotten above a d on any of my exams so far, despite studying for hours and feeling as though i understood the material. the stress about passing has been building all semester. im currently sitting at a c-, and i need at least a 35/40 on the exam to pass. i have been trying to study for days, but i just get even more stressed and depressed when i try, so i havent done anything more than watch a few vids and look up a formula review. i only have a day and a half left- i really need to cram. do yall have any tips or advice on how i can pull it off? should i contact my professor? im willing to try anything at this point."

"ive just come home from a pretty decent, much needed party where i had a good time, but ever since i got home by myself i cant shake the old, bad feelings off.. it just feels like they assaulted me all at once and its a lot to deal with. what makes me sad is that they somehow always come back to me even during a decent time of my life, also this feeling of being alone.. i just wanted to get this it out there so that maybe someone can read it and feel less alone in this world, take care everybody, sending much love to you all."

for those who havent its this great terry gilliam movie starring robin williams and jeff bridges where bridges plays this down on his luck former radio show host who befriends a homeless man played by williams. the reason <e1>i bring this movie up</e1> is <e2>i think it does a fantastic job portraying how many of us feel when were faced with depression and grief</e2>. dont want to give away any spoilers but i highly recommend it if you are looking for a movie to lift your spirits though certain scenes can be tough to watch depending on what youre going through.

"<e1>im finding out that i cant take my viibryd anymore</e1> because <e2>its too expensive</e2>. <e3>my insurance sucks like you wouldnt believe</e3>, so <e4>i might have to end up paying like $300 again for my antidepressant</e4>. i cant afford that. i was looking and it seems like everything else is cheaper. probably because they have a generic version and viibryd doesnt. im just. so mad. i feel like ive been through a laundry list of medications. and im always switching. im just at my wits end. im so tired. <e5>but i cant afford the $300. i have 5 or so pills left (i think i dont remember)</e5> so <e6>i could make it until monday</e6>. (ill edit this post whenever i get home with the final count). and my pharmacy is open on sundays. <e7>im just anxious that they wont get back to me on time</e7>. because <e8>their office tends to not call me back</e8>. im at a loss. i dont know what to do. im overwhelmed. <e9>i need to switch but i dont know if ill have the right amount of pills to get me through the week</e9>. because <e10>if im going through withdrawals im calling off</e10>. but i work a double on saturdays. i mean i know all j can do is wait and see what they say. i told them on my message that they need to get back to me quickly."

"i've been back on dating since february after my diagnosis in last june and i really do not know when i should share my situation with the other person.in february, there was a guy i was interested in, but i did not feel dateable one day and i just told him right away like that. but my expectation was from to ask hey what is wrong or something. he just laughed, ignored and did not ask something.next day, he stopped texting me while he was texting every morning. i assumed he is busy but then i asked him in late afternoon. he told me he decided to give me time to solve my problems. <e1>i was pissed off</e1> because <e2>he decided this by himself</e2>.<e3>i really do not wanna share this</e3> because <e4>you kind of start to know each other but when i had down days</e4>, i feel like i am lying to them and wasting their time.how was your experience when you started to date again after being diagnosed?"

"27m from s?o paulo, brazil. i live with my mom, 53, and dad 88. since 2012 hes diagnosed with parkinsons and dementia. i struggle with depression since i was 15. mentally, im always judging and blaming me for not having a job, not have become a doctor, rich, so i could pay caregivers for him, and hire someone for helping my mom at home. ive graduated in history. but where i live in currently theres no job for teachers not to mention historian. i could tell all my story, but im not looking for apologies. im just desperate i dont want, im not mentally able to take care of him. im furious, frustrated and really angry to confront him sick. i fear to do him some harm if i get completely tired of things he is not blamed for (not being able to eat, go to bathroom and walk for himself). im seeing a therapist and a psychiatrist. but the meds are doing no good yet. what would you guys do? if you really feel unable to get out of bed. if all you wanted was to sleep and dont wake up ever again. to put some noise cancelling headphones in order not to even listen to his voice shouting all the time for help or moaning due to his illness? please could someone help me? send some piece of advice? thank you if you have read all of this"

"hello. im 19/f. the first time i remember worrying about this i was around 10. as i was a kid i got over it fast. then it came up on me when i was 16, got depressed/stopped eating/stopped going to school/etc. i took antidepressants and eventually didnt get over it but could push it to the back of my head to think about later. for the past few weeks its been back. its crippling. i think of nothing but this fear. everything i try to do is interrupted by it whether it be eating or picking up an item off the floor. i enjoy nothing, i want nothing, and i feel trapped no matter where i am or what time of day it is. and then i have a single glimmer of being interested in something but my mind creeps forward with why do you care about this when nothing matters?i just got antidepressants again today but im so scared they wont work and ill be stuck like this. the worst part (and ik this sounds bad) is i almost wish i didnt fear death/what comes with it just so i could be suicidal and at least have an option besides this suffering. as it is, i feel like my life is over and ill never get over this. if anyone has any advice let me know. i live with my father and hes very worried about me not being able to function. as in he thinks i should do an inpatient program. im so scared and tired."

i hope i am right in this sub. my girlfriend has a form of depression and also goes to a therapist regularly. <e1>at the beginning she tried not to talk about this topic which i totally can understand</e1> sincs <e2>im not ger boyfriend for a very long time and she is a bit ashamed about it</e2>. but with the time we had conversations about it and i think it helped her to talk with somebody about and who isn't her therapist. but  in situations like a mental breakdown or really depressed phases i just don't know how to react. <e3>i want to understand and help her but i also don't want to make it worse with conversations</e3> <e4>which only seem good to me</e4>. so can you give me any advise on how to support her without making it worse?

i feel lethargic and unmotivated even when i start getting antsy and i want to do stuff its like my body is paralyzed and i cant get up to do anything. i know what i want to do and what i need to do. i even made a list which usually helps and here i am on the couch. tv isnt even on but i just dont have it in me to get up. i just recently had a bought of depression mine comes and goes and its here right now. i hate myself for feeling lazy but i feel like the only way out of this is medication and ive always been strictly against medication. <e1>i need help i dont know what to do and i just lost my insurance</e1> due to <e2>my bf getting another job and they wouldnt let me get on it</e2>. i have the link to try to get insurance through the state but i just sit here. depression hasnt hit me this hard in a long time. i need major help.

i have four songs on a playlist that equals to 15 minutes which is how long it takes to bleed out from a cut down the wrist. its the most beautiful music ive heard in my life and its what i want to die listening to

"i moved july 2019 and never unpacked. stuff has just kind of piled up around the boxes.when i google ""how to clean a messy house"" i get like those houses that are super clean with like magazines and shoes scattered around. i'm not like hoarders bad, but its going to need a battle plan.i have 2 weeks until the summer semester starts. i'm a little manic and i think i'm ready to take advantage of this. i just don't know where to start.my mom told me she will help, and i need to get some large storage totes. other than that i don't know what to do. i have 2 bedrooms (1 bedroom and 1 i use as an office/study), an open living room/dining room/kitchen, and a bathroom. i have said that since i've gone this long without using so much of my stuff, i will likely donate a lot of it.how do i tackle this? i don't even know where to start."

"i didn't do what i wanted to, i never felt i was good enough to do anything and i was always influenced by my parents or friends. i was too scared to use my voice. i wasn't confident, i was weak minded. i ended up ignoring my emotions and feeding into addictions. i was always too scared to be who i am. i was always the quiet kid and i refuse to be quiet anymore. i am going to be the person i want to be. i'm going to dedicate my time to self care and ignore others if they say hurtful things or try to bring me down. i'm going to get my priorites straight and stop wasting the days. <e1>i also didn't belive i could change</e1> because <e2>this is all i know</e2>. i've always been an outcast, i've never been healthy or looked well, it made me think differently from people and reject them. it sounds horrible i know but it's the way i am. i want to change this. i want to be healthy, happy and motivated instead of so depressed all the time. i accept this is apart of me and i want to move on."

"please let me know if there's a better sub for this question. i'm sorry if i waste your time. my partner and i have been on the rocks lately. they're disabled and can't work to support themselves. this means if we actually do break up, (<e1>as i fear we must</e1>, because <e2>they claim i've been abusing them this whole time and i've felt that they'd been abusing me</e2>) <e3>they'd be homeless</e3> and they swear this isn't a reason for <e4>them not wanting to leave</e4> but i don't see how that's possible. we still love each other so much, and that's been clouding this too.now the part that relates to this sub! i've had depression for years and have been able to make it through some way or another- but this has made it nearly debilitating. i'm constantly shaking and nauseous, and have genuinely thrown up and dry heaved from this. <e5>i know i'm not really sick</e5> because <e6>the second i'm fairly distracted i feel fine</e6>- <e7>it's only when i think of them or the situation (which is constantly</e7> because <e8>we've built our lives around each other for two years</e8>, and this is my first adult relationship therefore also my first major adult (potential) breakup. i can't even get through my four hour work shifts because i feel so sick.does anyone else experience physical illness when their mental health takes a dive? how do you push through it? i'm in agony."

"in my friend group there's 6 people (including me), two of which i have been friends with for 5 plus years, the other three for only a year ish. the two friends which i have been friends with for longer no longer talk to the other 4 of us. one of the girls made a terrible joke which i believe caused this. the two friends don't have a problem with me, it's just the others. <e1>it's so toxic, i hate all of them to be honest but i can't get any new friends</e1> because <e2>i'm so unpopular</e2>. im constantly the subjects of jokes but no one thinks twice. i was on the verge of tears the other day after having a awful lesson and being shouted at but they just laughed at me. i hate everyone so much but i don't know what to do. i'm so depressed and have no one to even talk to about my problems, ontop of that i'm trans and i can't handle people using she/her pronouns anymore. i'd rather just isolate myself from them. dysphoria is killing me and i can't take it anymore."

last week my depressed boyfriend left me.  even at the end he was telling me how much he loved me. <e1>and he was anguished</e1> with <e2>how much he felt made me suffer</e2> and how he thought i would be better off with someone who could give to me .  this is so hard for me to understand. i wouldve helped him in anyway possible and loved and supported him until the end of my days. even if he couldnt give back to me.he said i made him feel safe and loved and happier than anyone else. how can i make sense of this? i ask that you help me understand the perspective of a depressed person on this. its hard for me to understand why he would give up a source of comfort and love.i love him so much and hate to think of him alone and in misery. and then <e3>i start to hate myself</e3> because <e4>i wonder if i was a better girlfriend  that i could have helped him and he would not leave me</e4>. the logical part of me says that i did everything i could but my heart doesnt feel that way.  at the same time i loved him so much and he knew it. any insight would be appreciated.

"hey i'm zander and i'm 18 years old. i've been depressed off and on again for the last few years, and i'm not sure on what else to do. right now i've hit my deepest depression yet, i'm also addicted to p (<e1>i can't say the full word</e1> because <e2>i have a blocker app installed</e2>) since i was in 7th grade, and last year i started to see the effects it was having on me. <e3>i'm super stressed out</e3> because of <e4>my high school graduation and going to college</e4>, <e5>i'm sad</e5> because <e6>my great grandpa passed away last week</e6> and my uncle is dealing with cancer. my passed dating relationships still haunt me, and in one in particular where i was not treated very well, and laugh all you want cause, i'm a guy that was hurt by a girl. anyways, i want to tell my parents how i really am, but i'm to scared to tell them especial about my p addiction...so i need some help here guys. i don't want to try and kill myself again, there's so much i want to do in my life. so, please people help."

"its my chance for a serious job and i will probably stay there for a while if everything goes well. its important for me to act normal so people would think im alright. in my temp job <e1>everyone thought im weird and/or dumb</e1> (<e2>couse i have trouble focusing and expressing myself/ talking with people</e2>) it realy made me feel so much worse. <e3>in this new place everyone seem very friendly and i remembered to smile and look them in the eyes when we met</e3> so <e4>they probably think im nice just little nervous and i dont want to screw it up</e4>. do you have any tips for having anxiety and depression under control at work? i use to repeat special words to calm myself down and stop overthinking but doing that at works makes me feel crazy (even though nobody can hear). working is realy challenging emotionaly for me but i need money for therapy. i had psychological issues since i was like 10 but last few months are something else. it got seriously out of control, almost unbearable and its about time to get profesional help. im trying my best but im so drained out of energy. its realy difficult to fight with my own mind for every single day. and to do my job well when i cant even think straight anymore."

"i want to get better for me and my family. its hard. i dont even know what caused all this to happen. i was on some meds but i felt numb which was the worst thing ever. right now i cant even identify how i feel. just, done? ive definitely had more emotions since stopping the meds i think. im not going to do anything dumb but in a sense i feel like part of me is gone. i have intrusive thoughts about my death all the time and it sucks. sometimes i think i may need to be bedridden for a while just to give up with the help of my family and then renter the world.whats crazy is i have like 50/50 days where im doing better and coping well and days where it just feels like im hanging on. the thing is im afraid of medication. i think it can have long-lasting effects and im not sure its worth it. i dont want to be admitted inpatient and have things forced on me because i would probably only try very specific meds they may not give. i wont do ssris or antipsychotics, and still im cautious of everything.i want to get better."

"<e1>i'm so depressed but no one believes me, i can't even have a shower anymore without crying</e1> because <e2>i hate my body</e2>. i hate all the femenine nicknames of my birth name. <e3>i'm constantly begging me mum to let me get my hair cut</e3> so <e4>even a tiny bit of dysphoria is gone but she keeps telling me to wait</e4>. <e5>lately she's been constantly tells me i'm grumpy</e5> because <e6>my period is comming up soon</e6>, even though i've told her many times how uncomfortable i am even speaking about it. i hate my chest and my curvy thighs. why couldn't i just be born a boy. no one takes me seriously when i tell them how big of an impact being trans has on me, <e7>i hate everyone, no one likes me. my friends barely even talk to me, we're always fighting</e7> because <e8>i say how much i wish i was a boy and i'm so antisocial that i can't get any new ones</e8>. i can't live like this and i don't think i can even do another month, let alone years at school being called the wrong pronouns and name. i have no hope anymore, i don't even know what imaginary i'm clinging onto anymore. i'm so unempathetic and selfish and get reminded all the time. all of my friends hate me and i have nothing in common with anyone i know. i don't know what to do, please help."

"i hope it is okay to enter this space. ive been depressed in the past but it was very context-specific, and ive been okay for several years. im trying to figure out how to support my husband without becoming co-dependent. how do you recommend navigating child rearing with a depressed spouse?we both work full time, but i am the default parent. <e1>for the first year i was nursing</e1>, so <e2>some of it had to be on me</e2>. i was the one getting up multiple times a night... <e3>but he has more trouble sleeping</e3>. so <e4>ive also been the one to get up first in the morning with the baby</e4>, while he kept sleeping.<e5>he has bigger emotions and gets stressed/flustered more easily (i would label him a highly sensitive person)</e5>, so <e6>tend to step in and care for the baby more often</e6>.it feels like he has more needs, whereas i just have preferences, and needs always trip preferences. but it ends up feeling unfair.if he had a cold, i wouldnt think twice about bearing the heavier childcare burden. but i also know i default to being a people-pleaser, feeling responsible for doing all i can to keep the people around me from having negative emotions.how do i figure out when to do more than my share to support a struggling spouse, and when to get in touch with/speak up for my own desires for things to be more balanced?"

"i'm cringing at how i respond to my group convos. i'm tasked as leader in a task and i hate how i do not have this command in words. outwardly, <e1>i look confident and outspoken but i feel quite the imposter</e1> because <e2>i only leave a good first impression</e2>, other than that, when they get to know me, they'll find out i'm not as great as they think. maybe that's why i don't have many friends.but these past few days, <e3>i hated myself for creating silly misses in graded activities</e3> because <e4>i always sleep late</e4>. <e5>i hated how maybe i have poor reading comprehension</e5> because <e6>everyone gets the case scenarios at first glance</e6>. but today, i got an okay amount of sleep and i still needed to double backread messages thinking i got their point then executing instructions, only to find out <e7>my groupmates kept on asking what to do and not agreeing with me</e7> because <e8>they're clueless</e8>. <e9>i later realized i again, made a silly mistake and i can't take back my instructions anymore</e9> because <e10>that would make it look that i'm indecisive as heck</e10>.i have no idea why is this happening like suddenly i felt dumber this week it hurts. i need advice."

"<e1>i wouldn't mind going out into the world if  i could go to the park as if i did today with my son and instead of feeling ashamed</e1> because <e2>my social anxiety convinces me</e2> everyone's watching me and then feeling ashamed i'm so depressed its taking all of my energy to pretend to smile and laugh at my son whos being silly and in reality is probably being really funny but there's the numbness of depression separating me from the world and what i'm feeling, like there's an invisible wall between me in my son so he cant truly reach my heart and i cant reach his...i'm just dead. i wish i could just walk around saying yes i'm depressed and i wanna die and don't wanna smile and i just wanna lay in this patch of grass by the pond and sun and be revitalzed.lol that was more of a rant but in honestly, i just wish it was a world where we could talk about our ""negative""  emotions  without the stigma of being bad. i wouldn't mind my mental illnesses as much if i didn't have to mask them."

"hey, i'm new here [m41], diagnosed with depression when i was 28 and had on/off jobs since then, have been sacked from 1 job in the past for being late/not turning up and have pre-emptively left other jobs for the same reasons. i have trouble falling asleep and can't get into a routine. <e1>my gp won't prescribe any meaningful sleeping pills/aids</e1> <e2>because of the potential to overdose</e2>.my depressive state fluctuates and recently; while feeling ""ok"" i applied for a few jobs online. i have received emails/messages asking for further discussion/interviews and am now feeling quite apprehensive....what if i actually get the job, then the time comes when i'm not ""ok"" and turn up late or not at all? i have no problem with the work itself; i can do it and am actually quite good at it, and i'm a good worker; i've always been told that by previous employers, it's just the timekeeping and communication that's the problem, when it happens i get extremely embarrassed and shut myself away without talking to anyone.i don't really know what i want by posting this. should i mention my depression/sleeping issue at the interviews? are there any organisations that can help/advise someone like me to get back to work?many thanks."

"i have worked a handful of types of jobs over the last 10 years and realized that every single job triggers my depression. thinking about starting the work day makes me filled with dread. the entire time im working, i feel like i am fighting with myself to not feel incredibly sad and angry.part of me has wondered if its the type of jobs ive held, but i also havent had success securing any jobs in fields that im interested in so i havent been able to test that idea out. due to <e1>the pandemic</e1>, <e2>i lost my last job</e2>, and <e3>i learned that i was truly much happier being unemployed</e3> because <e4>i had the autonomy to plan my day however i wanted.im at a loss on what to do next</e4>. i try different coping mechanisms: yoga, meditation, breathing exercises, grounding exercises, manifestation, etc. i find that they help temporarily, but they dont rid me of the awful feeling that im wasting my life away just to make some money. ive thought about returning to schooling to focus on a career driven education, but schooling can be so expensive and there is nothing i am passionate about that feels worth the cost.any advice on how to cope or what next steps i could take?"

"<e1>my back is fucked up and is starting to get numb</e1> <e2>because i lie in bed all day and do nothing else</e2>. <e3>my skin is pale and yellow</e3> <e4>because i can't eat properly anymore</e4>. i'm weak, i'm ugly and unhealthy. even consistently maintaining basic hygiene has become a challenge.i'm sick of not being able to function normally. i'm sick of this pain. i'm sick of life but death isn't an option.i'm close to repeating the same mistakes. i fucked up my first year of college, decided to drop out only two months in, and it all went downhill from there. i don't feel capable of changing anymore, i've given up. i despise being a failure, a disappointment yet here i am, not doing anything about my laziness. i'm mad at myself, mad for always finding excuses, mad for not trying. this has been going on for years and i'm tired of it. i'm tired of barely being able to lift my own arms. i'm tired of hating myself.why can't i just change, why am i repeating the same mistakes over and over again. why do i keep on being lazy, even though i resent it so much. it's all my own fault."

idk if i forgot to take my meds yesterday but it feels like i did. id been fine since i started taking bupropion maybe a month ago but i feel like maybe i've been numb... distracted. i havent had bad thoughts but i also haven't been feeling better. i've just been existing. watching tv and playing sims. i got out of bed this morning and tried to clean my room for the first time in about 3 weeks and now i'm crying on my bedroom floor. thinking about how i want to die. how i'm ready. how there's nothing here for me. how i dont want anything but to leave. i've taken the pill at this point... but i'm still crying. its so cold in here. i want to get back into bed. so much for being productive.

"hello everyone,not sure what the point of writing this is.  when i feel overwhelmed nothing else matters.  i can't accept advice for more than a few days.  after that i regress and return to my old ways.  it seems like i'm addicted to shoving my problems away, facing them for a little, and then stumbling into the void again.  rinse and repeat.  when i feel myself getting better and growing optimistic, pressure builds up inside me until i give in.i've wanted to leak out this baggage in-person gradually to family and friends, but i'm too scared.  life's always been an uphill battle with my insecurities but recently they've consumed everything.  for the past four years i've been fighting my own personality, interests, and sexuality.  because of <e1>my fragile sense of pride</e1>, <e2>i have little inner-motivation to better myself</e2>.  i might not express it in public, but i've never doubted myself as much as i do now."

"for a few days i've felt as if my depression is going to hit me again at full blast. i have been stable for more than two years, going to therapy and being happy most of the time. surely i knew that this is never going to be over, but i really felt like i had a recipe for dealing with it and getting through bad episodes.this is different. an early sign for my depression has always been irritability and needing lots of sleep. well, even the most minor thing makes me burn inside with hate and the wish to scream at or smash something with my fist. also i tend to sleep a lot, especially after work. plus i have this new fun hobby of binge eating after i come home from work, even though i'm not hungry.<e1>i want to get this under control asap</e1>, because <e2>i know it'll just get worse and make me ruin my relationship</e2>. i am scared, please help me."

"i was diagnosed with depression about 15 years ago. and it's been difficult to deal with that entire time. there are times when everything's good, i feel happy and emotionally stable. and then, for seemingly no reason, it'll be like i can't really ""feel"" anything. my emotions feel muted. i can still feel them, kind of. but their potency is severely lessened. this often happens completely out of nowhere. i can go from feeling good to feeling this emotional block in a matter of minutes. and it can last anywhere from a few hours to days. and i dont really know what to do about it. it makes it genuinely difficult to enjoy even just simple things. i've started taking vitamin d supplements and using a sad light, but i'm not sure how much it's helped. it's been a few weeks, but i'm not sure how long it takes to see results with these things. <e1>i dont think i have bipolar disorder</e1>, because <e2>i don't experience periods of manic feelings</e2>. what can i do to deal with this?"

"<e1>my friend was planning to give ielts exam</e1> <e2>so he met a teacher who agreed to teach him and prepare him for the exams</e2>. she was so friendly and nice to him that he thought she was giving him hints. he tried to flirt with her but she took it as a joke. but one day he called her at night which made her very angry , so angry that she called his father first thing in the morning and told him how annoying he is and how he tried to flirt with her . my friends father calmed her down and assured her that he wont repeat these action . thats when the overthinking started . now before sending her a message about his work he thinks 100 times that is this offending or not , he sends me to make sure the message wont make her angry . then covid happened. which made everything much worse. he cant sleep at night waiting for reply of the message he sent . when she reply his message he starts overthinking what did she meant with the message. then he gave his exams in which he got very low score. now the situation is so worse that he is thinking of suicide and killing the teacher with him. i took him to a psychiatrist but he was awful and didnt knew anything. there is no other psychiatric facility anywhere near us. his situation is getting bad every day. he calls me at night crying. i dont know how to help him."

"is it my fault? every time she starts i feel like i am the worst person in the world. i can't help my tears. <e1>but i wish i could</e1> <e2>because she doesn't like when i am crying</e2> and it makes her full of ire.  <e3>i am quite busy</e3> <e4>due to finishing school this year</e4>. i am dealing with exam preparation and depression, so i don't really feel like washing floors and dishes every day.  i can't grasp why is she doing that. almost for every day and hour, she forces me to do some housework.  what is the purpose of doing that? <e5>i didn't wash the dishes yesterday</e5> and that is the reason <e6>she was screaming at me almost for 20 minutes</e6>. it feels like she cares about nothing in the world, but cleaning. she knows that i am depressed, she saw my self-harm scars and she doesn't give a damn. it feels like i am nothing, and i have no needs or purposes. <e7>she screams at me</e7> <e8>because i eat too much when i do my homework</e8>. she becomes mad just when i am at my lessons or when i am asking for money to pay for my courses and gym. she forces me to find a job, but i didn't even graduate from school. i applied to 24 universities, but i guess if i won't get in, she would be terribly mad. i am scared. what should i do?p. s. english is my third language. sorry for the mistakes."

"11.8 million lives are taken by addiction worldwide on a yearly basis. more than half who pass from a drink or drug are under the age of 50.20% of those who suffer from addiction have an underlying mental illness. only 10% of people can get the right help.women are much more likely to go to the er or die from an overdose.the completion of suicide is more common in men. along with most completions being attributed to the abuse of drugs and substances.the stigma of addiction is no longer an anchor that holds humanity hostage in ignorance. the outcomes of addiction are much more tragic than what weve allowed ourselves to witness in the past. the process of addiction takes us into lonely, overwhelming, negative, and hopeless places where the only end is death. for those who choose life, we embark on an ever-lasting journey to overcome the worst faces of human nature. the great thing is, that we are not alone.how we understand addiction is growing and changing. its worthwhile to open your eyes to a new perspective, it may help us see something that wasnt there before.if you have interest in exploring the topic of addiction, feel free to give this short talk a watch. an insiders perspective on the subject can always be refreshing.https://youtu.be/yngx-d5jeje"

"remember the anime my hero academia? it was the first anime i watched and i hadnt seen it in forever. but one day i was feeling depressed and i watched my favorite episode. the school festival in season 4. <e1>it was amazing</e1> <e2>because they saved a little girl</e2>. shes a toddler and she was physically abused horribly by a villain. the villain had the ability to literally melt her skin and turn it into weapons, almost slowly killing her in the process. then he would rearrange her body back and do it again. its horrible. but then the heroes saved her but she was still a toddler suffering from trauma. they took her to a school concert and as the heroes sang and dance and performed another hero held her up in the air and she had such a big smile and she was laughing and having fun. it was so wholesome and wonderful. they say that shes never smiled a day in her life i believe (btw correct me if im wrong with any of this) and now she was so ecstatic. just seeing a traumatized little girl smile again really helped. the entire anime is very inspiring. i really recommend watching it."

"for me this started about 4 months ago after i went through an existential crisis. while the existential thoughts have become a lot less amplified through meds and therapy, i'm still left completely numb. prior to my existential crisis, i was already depressed and couldn't really feel any positive emotions, but i could still feel sadness, get angry, negative emotions ect. now i can't really experience any emotions on either side of the spectrum, in fact it's like my conscience has turned off, i can't even feel repulsed now to horrible things you see on the news or get angry at people that used to get on my nerves, i kind of feel like i've been erased.i'm wondering if there's anyone who's been through this, is going through this, or has over come it. <e1>this is a really hard time for me, and i feel like i need support to make it through this</e1> because <e2>it makes living miserable and no one in my waking life can understand what i'm going through</e2>. if this resonates i'd be more than willing to talk through dm. thanks!"

"i really cant take it anymore. i live in london, 20m and have had type 1 diabetes for 3yrs as well as gastritis,ibs,acid reflux,candida and esophagitis. none of those conditions made me feel suicidal at all. i managed to take 2yrs of university and really focus on my health. i managed to cure all my gut problems however i have a ton of physical issues that i really want to commit suicide. i literally thought i could start university not having to worry about my health but here we go with these problems. i've jammed four fingers that hurt,have a bunch of tendonitis,carpal tunnel in both hands and thoracic outlet syndrome and small fiber neuropathy. i can't do normal activities without being in pain. my family dont understand and i feel hopeless. i really don't know what to do. getting all the tests to diagnose me will take so long. if anyone can speak to me over the phone i'd very much appreciate it. i dont want to have surgery to fix all these problems."

"hey all, i am a 24f who has dealt with depression for about 9 years with varying severity. i am currently on effexor after trying a bunch of meds and stable enough that i've held down a ft job for 3.5 years and now have a live-in partner.the details of my days, however, aren't great. i don't have energy or desire for hobbies beyond cooking dinner sometimes and watching an evening tv show with my boyfriend. i often find myself mentally exhausted and ready to shut down either at 5pm after work or later on around 8.30/9pm. it gets worse on days when i've struggled with negative thoughts.my partner doesn't really like how i go to bed early a lot, and is hurt that i dont want to stay up and spend time with him. i want to not always be so tired. after getting bloodwork done last week i know this is 100% psychological- my dr. knew about my fatigue but said my results were great. i'd like to be the kind of person who goes to the gym or for a walk after work but i always feel too heavy and sad.i often don't want to be awake if i could just be asleep and escape feeling sad/ negative/ tired. what can i do to fix this? has anyone been in a similar situation? thank you."

every time i set a day i dont have enough time to make everything perfect. writing notes will probably take 2 days of crying through writing them and deep cleaning will probably take a whole day or 2. and thats even if i can cut down my wrists after all that. im so sick living even though my life is easy i dont have a job i barely do any chores i dont even do my schoolwork anymore i just sleep and lay around with my depression and plan to kill myself. im just sick of staying alive.

"i just need advice.i've been helping my friends through their mental issues with positive affirmations and hope for the future. but its a lie, i dont believe anyone has a future, life sucks then we die. <e1>sometimes i feel bad for trying to keep them from killing themselves</e1>, as <e2>i believe they will be happier that way</e2>.  i don't want to think this but i've never seen anyone live a happy life. <e3>i need support , sadly from redditors</e3>, because  <e4>i dont think my friends can handle anything negative</e4>.ranti probably think this way because as a child i watched my family overwork themselves, working multiple jobs to support me and my siblings, just to go home and be miserable. mental illness kept them from being happy as a child, they never had the time to be happy as an adult, and being elderly is driving them to madness. my family has high expectations for me but i dont see the point. its not like having a good job or money will make me happy. mental illness has stolen my youth, ill overwork myself as an adult to eventually retire to a life of feeling that i wasted away."

"after a four month sick leave due to burn-out and severe depression, i started working again today. and i just can't!i feel like i'm in over my head, although it's the same job as before. somehow it just feels all wrong and i could cry the entire time.heck, i'm almost 43 years old and i have nothing to show for in my life! no so, no children, no friends. only my family and my fur-babies give me any sort of comfort.<e1>i have my own appartment, but prefer spending time at my parents' house</e1>, because <e2>that's where my cats live</e2> (i don't want to take them away from their own private garden-and-woods paradise to live in a tiny appartment).at the moment i feel like i've reached the end of my road. somewhere along the way i lost all of my wishes and dreams and became this permanently depressed shadow of the person i had hoped to be!i am in therapy and it helps some, but i feel like the dark days keep getting darker while the happy days keep getting fewer and fewer. does it even make sense to go on?sorry for the rant..."

"growing up, i've mostly been alone. i had friends, sure, but i always preferred being myself. but there are times where i wished that i had a brother or sister to talk to whenever i was down or i was just having problems.i have my mom sure (my dad left us early) but back then and even now, we didn't have the best relationship because she always judged me, which made me not want to share anything about my personal life.life isn't all bad though. there are perks that comes with being an only child. for one, i don't have to deal with the possibility of having strenuous relationships with any siblings. some are lucky enough to be really close with their brothers and/or sisters, but there will eventually be problems that'll test how strong their bonds are and it's possible that they could be shattered. i also get to keep whatever cool gifts all to myself so there's that.so for all my other only children there, i hope you guys are having a good life. oh, i also made something that helps shows the positives of being an only child. hope it manages to help anyone.https://youtu.be/amz2opigkds"
